location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Colonel Lewis Pelly to Captain Philip Durham Henderson, Under Secretary, Foreign Department, Government of India

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing a letter from Major William Howell Beynon on the Kishengurh [Kishangarh] Peshcush (an offering or tribute).Letter from William Howell Beynon, Simla to Colonel Lewis Pelly, Officiating Agent Governor General, 10 October 1873, regarding the amount of His Highness (of Kishangarh)'s Peshcush and detailing how the amount has been calculated. The letter also discusses the question of discontinuing the presentation of Khilluts to attendants, which Beynon believes would not be a problem as long as the sons of Chief's and Sirdars were excepted.An addendum to the letter dated 17 October 1873 requests that Adelbert Cecil Talbot make a copy of the letter.
